item.title: Jane add a quote by Sue Monk Kidd
item.description: "Every human being on the face of the earth has a steel plate in his head, but if you lie down now and then and get still as you can, it will slide open like elevator doors, letting in all the secret thoughts that have been standing around so patiently, pushing the button for a ride to the top. The real troubles in life happen when those hidden doors stay closed for too long." -- Sue Monk Kidd

item.title: Jane add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "1492. As children we were taught to memorize this year with pride and joy as the year people began living full and imaginative lives on the continent of North America. Actually, people had been living full and imaginative lives on the continent of North America for hundreds of years before that. 1492 was simply the year sea pirates began to rob, cheat, and kill them." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jane add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The fact that we live at the bottom of a deep gravity well, on the surface of a gas covered planet going around a nuclear fireball 90 million miles away and think this to be normal is obviously some indication of how skewed our perspective tends to be." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Jane add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "I wanted you to see what real courage is, instead of getting the idea that courage is a man with a gun in his hand. It's when you know you're licked before you begin, but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what. - Atticus Finch" -- Harper Lee

item.title: Jane add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "And how could we endure to live and let time pass if we were always crying for one day or one year to come back--if we did not know that every day in a life fills the whole life with expectation and memory and that these are that day?" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Jane add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You don't have to burn books to destroy a culture. Just get people to stop reading them." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Jane add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Part of the secret of success in life is to eat what you like and let the food fight it out inside." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Jane add a quote by William Wordsworth
item.description: "The best portion of a good man's life: his little, nameless unremembered acts of kindness and love." -- William Wordsworth

item.title: Jane add a quote by Amber Deckers
item.description: "Never regret something that once made you smile." -- Amber Deckers

item.title: Jane add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The only way to get rid of temptation is to yield to it." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Jane add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If you want to know what God thinks of money, just look at the people he gave it to." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Jane add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Sometimes it is harder to deprive oneself of a pain than of a pleasure." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Jane add a quote by Jack London
item.description: "You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club." -- Jack London

item.title: Jane add a quote by André Maurois
item.description: "In literature as in love, we are astonished at what is chosen by others." -- André Maurois

item.title: Jane add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "If all the year were playing holidays; To sport would be as tedious as to work." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jane add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Every creature is better alive than dead, men and moose and pine trees, and he who understands it aright will rather preserve its life than destroy it. " -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Jane add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "People’s good deeds we write in water. The evil deeds are etched in brass." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jane add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Jane add a quote by James Patterson
item.description: "Just because life is hard, and always ends in a bad way, doesn't mean that all stories have to, even if that's what they tell us in school and in the New York Times Review. In fact, it's a good thing that stories are as different as we are, one from another." -- James Patterson

item.title: Jane add a quote by Ben Bova
item.description: "Red tape has killed more people than bullets..." -- Ben Bova

item.title: Jane add a quote by Jonathan Carroll
item.description: "The only way to make beauty ugly is to show it's crazy. Like twisting the top off a jar of something wonderful to eat, the moment he's hit by the terrible smell of it gone bad, even the hungriest person will drop the jar in the trash without a second thought." -- Jonathan Carroll

item.title: Jane add a quote by Susanna Kaysen
item.description: "Lunatics are similar to designated hitters. Often an entire family is crazy, but since an entire family can't go into the hospital, one person is designated as crazy and goes inside. Then, depending on how the rest of the family is feeling that person is kept inside or snatched out, to prove something about the family's mental health." -- Susanna Kaysen

item.title: Jane add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Jane add a quote by Sloane Crosley
item.description: "I find that anything culturally significant that happened before '93 I associate with the decade before it. In fact, Oregon Trail is one of a handful of signposts that middle school existed at all." -- Sloane Crosley

item.title: Jane add a quote by Dan Brown
item.description: "History is always written by the winners. When two cultures clash, the loser is obliterated, and the winner writes the history books-books which glorify their own cause and disparage the conquered foe. As Napoleon once said, 'What is history, but a fable agreed upon?" -- Dan Brown

item.title: Jane add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Jane add a quote by Lauren Groff
item.description: "Even still, we run. We have not reached our average of 57.92 years without knowing that you run through it, and it hurts and you run through it some more, and if it hurts worse, you run through it even more, and when you finish, you will have broken through. In the end, when you are done, and stretching, and your heartbeat slows, and your sweat dries, if you've run through the hard part, you will remember no pain." -- Lauren Groff

item.title: Jane add a quote by Lauren Groff
item.description: "Amor animi arbitrio sumitu, non ponitur; we choose to love; we do not choose to cease loving." -- Lauren Groff

item.title: Jane add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "If it weren't for greed, intolerance, hate, passion and murder, you would have no works of art, no great buildings, no medical science, no Mozart, no Van Gough, no Muppets and no Louis Armstrong." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Jane add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "We've been rehearsing a classic from antiquity, <i>Green Eggs and Hamlet</i>, the story of a young prince of Denmark who goes mad, drowns his girlfriend, and in his remorse, forces spoiled breakfast on all whom he meets." -- Christopher Moore
